item.title: Git Submodules
item.description:
Eman's Blog https://emandeguzman.github.io/posts/git-submodules/ -

Delete a Submodule

  1. Open .gitmodules and remove the entry of the submodule to delete

    Sample entry to remove from .gitmodules

    [submodule "path/to/submodule/folder"]
    path = path/to/submodule/folder
    url = https://github.com/submodule/to_delete.git

     

  2. Stage the changes in .gitmodules

    git add .gitmodules

     

  3. Open .git/config and remove the entry of the submodule to delete

    Sample entry to remove from .git/config

    [submodule "path/to/submodule/folder"]
    url = https://github.com/submodule/to_delete.git
    active = true

     

  4. Delete submodule folder using git rm

    git rm --cached path/to/submodule/folder

     

  5. Delete submodule directory under .git/modules

    rm -rf .git/modules/name_of_submodule_to_delete

     

  6. Commit changes done so far

    git commit -m "Removed submodule <submodule name>"

     

  7. Make sure there are no more files of the deleted submodule

        rm -rf path/to/submodule/folder
- https://emandeguzman.github.io/posts/git-submodules/ - This is a customized copyright.

item.title: VS Code Key Bindings for Multi-line Editing
item.description:
Eman's Blog https://emandeguzman.github.io/posts/multiline-edit/ -
Shortcut Keys Description
Alt+Click Insert cursor
Ctrl+Alt+↑/↓ Insert cursor above/ below
Ctrl+U Undo last cursor operation
Shift+Alt+I Insert cursor at end of each line selected
Ctrl+L Select current line
Ctrl+Shift+L Select all occurrences of current selection
Ctrl+F2 Select all occurrences of current word
Shift+Alt+→ Expand selection
Shift+Alt+← Shrink selection
Shift+Alt+(drag mouse) Column (box) selection
Ctrl+Shift+Alt+(arrow key) Column (box) selection
Ctrl+Shift+Alt+PgUp/PgDn Column(box)selection page up/down
- https://emandeguzman.github.io/posts/multiline-edit/ - This is a customized copyright.

item.title: Different ways of hiding elements
item.description:
Eman's Blog https://emandeguzman.github.io/posts/hiding_elements/ -
Method read by screen reader affectsdocument layout rendered responds to events
display: none no no no no
visibility=hidden no yes yes no
opacity=0 yes yes yes yes
position=absolute yes no yes yes
- https://emandeguzman.github.io/posts/hiding_elements/ - This is a customized copyright.

item.title: Safari overflow
item.description:
Eman's Blog https://emandeguzman.github.io/posts/safari_overflow/ -

Motivation

I encountered this situation where Safari’s display would overflow when the keyboard shows up. This ruins the whole page even when the elements have a width of 100% and body has and overflow-x hidden set.

Solution

In head, add a meta tag for viewport like

meta name="viewport” content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1,maximum-scale=1,user-scalable=0">

width would set the viewport’s width to that of the device’s width.
initial-scale makes sure the zoom level is initially set to 1 (100%).
maximum-scale prevent’s zooming beyond 100%.
user-scalable disallows the device to zoom in or out.
minimum-scale though not included in the fix. I just added it here for completeness. This sets the minimum amount of zooming the can be done for the device.

- https://emandeguzman.github.io/posts/safari_overflow/ - This is a customized copyright.
